rev.comment: Undid revision 419456816 by [[Special:Contributions/One last pharaoh|One last pharaoh]] ([[User talk:One last pharaoh|talk]]) That picture is photoshopped. She never was a hegabi

+
[[File:Sally Zahran.png|thumb|Sally Zahran, who was killed during the demonstrations]]
Leading up to the protests, at least six cases of [[self-immolation]] were reported, including a man arrested while trying to set himself on fire in downtown Cairo.<ref name="Self-Immolation Spreads Across the Mideast">{{cite web|author=Rosenberg, David|url=http://www.themedialine.org/news/news_detail.asp?NewsID=31194|title=Self-Immolation Spreads Across the Mideast, Inspiring Protest, Controversy|work=[[The Media Line]]|date=24 January 2011|accessdate=25 January 2011}}</ref> These cases were inspired by, and began exactly one month after, the acts of self-immolation in Tunisia triggering the [[2010â2011 Tunisian uprising]]. Six instances have been reported, including acts by Abdou Abdel-Moneim Jaafar,<ref name="Abdou Abdel-Moneim">{{cite web|url=http://www.aljazeera.net/NR/exeres/7F5D64C8-241F-4F34-B36A-4F259CBF3371.htm?GoogleStatID=20|title=ÙØµØ±Ù ÙØ­Ø±Ù ÙÙØ³Ù Ø£ÙØ§Ù Ø§ÙØ¨Ø±ÙÙØ§Ù|language=[[Arabic language|Arabic]]|work=[[Al Jazeera]]|date=17 January 2011|accessdate=25 January 2011}}</ref> Mohammed Farouk Hassan,<ref name="Mohammed Farouk Hassan">{{cite web|url=http://www.reuters.com/article/idUSTRE70H3L720110118|title=Egyptians Set Themselves Ablaze After Tunisia Unrest|author=Zayed, Dina|date=18 January 2011|work=[[Reuters]]|accessdate=25 January 2011}}</ref> Mohammed Ashour Sorour,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.elaosboa.com/show.asp?id=20522&vnum=fesal&page=mahalyat|title=ÙÙØ¸Ù Ø¨Ù'ÙØµØ± ÙÙØ·ÙØ±Ø§Ù' ÙÙØ¯Ø¯ Ø¨Ø­Ø±Ù ÙÙØ³Ù Ø£ÙØ§Ù ÙÙØ§Ø¨Ø© Ø§ÙØµØ­ÙÙÙÙ|language=[[Arabic language|Arabic]]|date=18 January 2011|work=[[El-Aosboa]] (newspaper)|accessdate=25 January 2011}}</ref> and Ahmed Hashim al-Sayyed who later died from his injuries.<ref name="Ahmed Hashim El-Sayyid2">{{cite web
Leading up to the protests, at least six cases of [[self-immolation]] were reported, including a man arrested while trying to set himself on fire in downtown Cairo.<ref name="Self-Immolation Spreads Across the Mideast">{{cite web|author=Rosenberg, David|url=http://www.themedialine.org/news/news_detail.asp?NewsID=31194|title=Self-Immolation Spreads Across the Mideast, Inspiring Protest, Controversy|work=[[The Media Line]]|date=24 January 2011|accessdate=25 January 2011}}</ref> These cases were inspired by, and began exactly one month after, the acts of self-immolation in Tunisia triggering the [[2010â2011 Tunisian uprising]].
